string-array.name: version_about
string-array.item: Version 1.5: Added the option to share recipes, and to import shared recipes. To use it you can go to the Edit tab and select the share button. Or in the menu there is a new option to Share all Menu Items. This will then let you choose an email program or similar to use to send a file detailing the recipes.

Version 2.0: Added the option to import recipes from your favourite websites. Either navigate to the recipe in your browser, select share, then choose Cooking Scheduler. Or in the Cooking Scheduler menu select \'Import recipe from website\' option. I\'ve also fixed many UI bugs for example when you rotate the screen.
Version 3.0: Revamped the UI to make it prettier and easier to use.
Version 3.1: Fixed a bug where TimePicker didn\'t work on Lollipop (Android 5.0)
Version 3.5: Added the option to export a schedule (so you could print it off) and added a What\'s New dialog on startup
Version 3.6: Updated the summary UI - added tickboxes to mark tasks as done
Version 3.7: Updated to run on Nougat (Android 7.1)

resources.string: Select some items by touching them before trying to start cooking.
Select some items by touching them before trying to export a schedule.

Display items that take too long

Hello!
How're you?
I hope you're having a jolly nice day.

I'm very glad you decided to download Cooking Scheduler.
This nifty little app was written by Amy Phillips in many teeny tiny precious bits of spare time.

Please email any problems, questions, offers of help, bags of swag or suggestions to cooking@thinkysaurus.com
When would you like to finish cooking?
Enter the URL for a recipe to parse

Whoops - something has gone wrong! I\'m very sorry and am sending an email crash report to Amy so she can fix it for you. If you\'re offered a choice of applications, please choose your favourite email client.
You need to allow accounts permissions to buy stuff
